lead_paragraph: The lily pad beetle moves about with a very rapid form of self-propelled windsurfing while staying tied to the surface. Stopping is another matter.

headline.print_headline: An Insect That Masters Water and Air
headline.main: An Insect That Masters Water and Air

snippet: The lily pad beetle moves about with a very rapid form of self-propelled windsurfing while staying tied to the surface. Stopping is another matter.
abstract: Dr Manu Prakash, who studies physics of water, publishes study in The Journal of Experimental Biology finding that lily pad beetle propels itself across surface of water by beating wings as if in flight but using claws to remain tethered to surface.
